intro: Minuartia janevii, commonly known as the rock chickweed, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers that bloom in the spring. This species is typically found in rocky or gravelly habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is native to regions of Europe and Asia, often growing in alpine or arctic environments. Minuartia janevii is a hardy plant that is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a common sight in mountainous and coastal areas.
